<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	"Class&nbsp;B
	Stock Closing"). To exercise the Class&nbsp;B Option, PBM was required to provide written notice of its intent on or before February&nbsp;28, 2014 after which date the
	Class&nbsp;B Option would terminate.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;After
	the Class&nbsp;B Stock Closing, the Company also agreed to sell and PBM agreed to purchase, on the same terms and conditions, 1,011,721 additional shares of Class&nbsp;B-1
	preferred stock (the "Class&nbsp;B-1 Milestone Shares") and a warrant to purchase 163,278 additional shares of Class&nbsp;B-2 preferred stock (the "Milestone Warrant") on the same terms and
	conditions. The Class&nbsp;B-1 Milestone Shares were to
	be sold and the Milestone Warrant was to be issued within ten days of the date that the Company certified that the data and safety monitoring board appointed by the FDA had approved the dosing of the
	7
<SUP>
	th
</SUP>
	&nbsp;patient in the Company's Phase&nbsp;1 clinical trial.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	February&nbsp;27, 2014, PBM provided notice of its intent to exercise the Class&nbsp;B Option. On March&nbsp;7, 2014, the Company issued to PBM 1,011,721 shares of
	Class&nbsp;B-1 preferred stock at $2.47 per share in exchange for $2,000,000 of cash and the conversion of the Class&nbsp;B Note. In conjunction with the purchase of the Class&nbsp;B-1 preferred
	stock, the Company also issued the Class&nbsp;B-2 Warrant to PBM to purchase 130,623 shares of Class&nbsp;B-2 preferred stock at an exercise price of $2.57 per share.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	April 2015, the Company certified that the data and safety monitoring board appointed by the FDA had approved the dosing of the 7
<SUP>
	th
</SUP>
	&nbsp;patient in the Company's
	Phase&nbsp;1 clinical trial. As a result, on May&nbsp;4, 2015, the Company issued the Class&nbsp;B-1 Milestone Shares and the Milestone Warrant to PBM in exchange for $2,500,000 of cash.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Class&nbsp;B-2 Warrant and the Milestone Warrant may be exercised by the holder, in whole or in part, upon the payment of the exercise price in cash. The Class&nbsp;B-2 Warrant
	and the Milestone Warrant terminate upon the earliest to occur of (a)&nbsp;the 10&nbsp;year anniversary of their issuance date or (b)&nbsp;a liquidation event, as defined therein.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
<U>
	Class&nbsp;C Preferred Stock
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	August&nbsp;11, 2014, the Company entered into a Class&nbsp;C Stock Purchase Agreement with Deerfield Private Design Fund III ("Deerfield") and Roche
	Finance&nbsp;Ltd ("Roche").
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;At
	closing, Deerfield purchased 504,478 shares of Class&nbsp;C preferred stock at a price of $3.96 per share and converted the original principal amount and accrued and unpaid interest
	on a secured promissory note dated June&nbsp;20, 2014 (see Note&nbsp;11) in the original principal amount of $500,000 into 126,991 shares of Class&nbsp;C preferred stock at a conversion price of
	$3.96 per share.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;At
	closing, Roche purchased 630,606 shares of Class&nbsp;C preferred stock at a purchase price of $3.96 per share.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;After
	the initial closing, the Company agreed to sell, and Deerfield and Roche each agreed to purchase, an aggregate of 551,472 additional shares of Class&nbsp;C preferred stock at a
	purchase price of
	$4.53 per share (the "Class&nbsp;C Milestone Shares") upon the later to occur of the following milestones (the "Class&nbsp;C Milestone Event"):
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>

</FONT>

	15&nbsp;days of the date upon which the Company notifies both Deerfield and Roche that the dosing of the 6
<SUP>

</SUP>

	Phase&nbsp;1 clinical trial has occurred; or

<SUP>

</SUP>

	clinical trial.

<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=144,EFW="2227870",CP="AVEXIS INC.",DN="1",CHK=24243,FOLIO='140',FILE='DISK129:[16ZAR1.16ZAR45901]FQ45901A.;6',USER='HYUNG',CD='18-MAR-2016;13:26' -->
<A NAME="A2227870Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_FQ45901_1_141">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227870Z10-K_HTM_BG45901A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	AveXis,&nbsp;Inc.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	10. Capitalization (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Neither
	Deerfield nor Roche was required to purchase any Class&nbsp;C Milestone Shares if either (A)&nbsp;the 6
<SUP>
	th
</SUP>
	&nbsp;patient was not dosed by April&nbsp;15, 2015
	or as of or prior to April&nbsp;15, 2015, the clinical trial had been stopped, suspended or put on partial or complete hold for patient safety reasons. Either Deerfield or Roche was permitted, at
	their sole discretion, to purchase their portion of the Class&nbsp;C Milestone Shares at any time, irrespective of the occurrence of a Class&nbsp;C Milestone Event, by providing 5&nbsp;days
	written notice.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Class&nbsp;C Milestone Event occurred in March 2015 and on March&nbsp;17, 2015, the Class&nbsp;C Milestone Shares were purchased by Deerfield and Roche in exchange for an
	aggregate purchase price of $5,000,020 in cash.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
<U>
	Class&nbsp;D Preferred Stock Issuance
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	September&nbsp;3, 2015, the Company entered into a Class&nbsp;D Stock Purchase Agreement pursuant to which the Company issued and sold an aggregate of
	3,093,092 shares of Class&nbsp;D preferred stock at a price per share of $21.01 for an aggregate of $64,787,549, net of issuance costs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	11. Convertible Notes
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
<U>
	Class&nbsp;B Note
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	January&nbsp;30, 2014, the Company entered into the Class&nbsp;B Purchase Agreement with PBM (see Note&nbsp;10). Under the Class&nbsp;B Purchase
	Agreement, the Company sold to PBM a $500,000 convertible promissory note (the "Class&nbsp;B Note") and granted PBM the Class&nbsp;B Option. The Class&nbsp;B Note had a stated maturity of
	January&nbsp;31, 2016 and accrued interest at 8% per annum. The Class&nbsp;B Note could not be prepaid without the prior written consent of PBM.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If
	the Company were to receive gross proceeds of $500,000 or more from the issuance or sale of any equity securities to PBM or another third party, any time prior to January&nbsp;31,
	2016, (a "PBM Qualified Financing"), the Class&nbsp;B Note would automatically convert, at the price per share paid by the investors in the PBM Qualified Financing, into the class of equity
	securities sold in the PBM Qualified Financing.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If
	the Company completed a financing that was not considered a PBM Qualified Financing any time prior to January&nbsp;31, 2016, PBM, at its option, could convert the Class&nbsp;B
	Note, at the price per share paid by the investors in such a financing transaction, into the class of equity securities sold in the financing transaction.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Additionally,
	PBM, at its option, could elect to convert the Class&nbsp;B Note at any time prior to the earlier of the maturity date or the closing of a PBM Qualified Financing, into
	shares of the Company's Class&nbsp;B-1 preferred stock at a conversion price of $2.47 per share. Finally, if not earlier converted, The
	Class&nbsp;B Note would automatically convert into shares of the Company's Class&nbsp;B-1 preferred stock at a conversion price of $2.47 per share at maturity.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Company recorded the Class&nbsp;B Note in accordance with the guidance found in ASC 470-20. The conversion feature in the Class&nbsp;B Note qualifies for the exception from
	derivative accounting in accordance with ASC 815-40. The Company therefore allocated the $500,000 in proceeds received from PBM to the Class&nbsp;B Note, the Class&nbsp;B Option and the contingent
	Class&nbsp;B-1 Milestone shares based on their relative fair values.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	141
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=145,EFW="2227870",CP="AVEXIS INC.",DN="1",CHK=959647,FOLIO='141',FILE='DISK129:[16ZAR1.16ZAR45901]FQ45901A.;6',USER='HYUNG',CD='18-MAR-2016;13:26' -->
<A NAME="A2227870Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_FQ45901_1_142">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227870Z10-K_HTM_BG45901A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	AveXis,&nbsp;Inc.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	11. Convertible Notes (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	fair value of the Class&nbsp;B Option on the date of issuance, as calculated using the Black-Scholes model was $112,835, using the following assumptions: exercise price of $2.47
	per share; Class&nbsp;B-1 preferred stock price of $2.47 per share; volatility of 45%; term of one month; a dividend yield of 0%; and an interest rate of 0.40%.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	fair value of the contingent Class&nbsp;B-1 Milestone Shares was determined to be $0 because the $2.40 purchase price was equal to the fair value of a Class&nbsp;B-1 share as of
	the contract date. As a result, the Company recorded a discount of $112,835 related to the Class&nbsp;B Option.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	March&nbsp;7, 2014, the Company completed a PBM Qualified Financing with PBM and the outstanding principal amount of the Class&nbsp;B Note was converted into 202,345 shares of
	Class&nbsp;B-1 preferred stock at a conversion price of $2.47 per share and a Class&nbsp;B-2 Warrant to purchase 32,652 shares of Class&nbsp;B-2 preferred stock at an exercise price of $2.57 per
	share.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	a result, the unamortized debt discount associated with the Class&nbsp;B Option of $112,835 was recognized immediately as a loss on extinguishment of debt. Such amount has been
	recorded within interest expense in the consolidated statement of operations for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
<U>
	Deerfield Convertible Note
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	June&nbsp;19, 2014, the Company and Deerfield entered into a $500,000 secured promissory note (the "Deerfield Note"). The Deerfield Note accrued interest
	at a rate of 5%
	per year compounding annually on December&nbsp;31 of each year. In connection with the issuance of the Deerfield Note, Deerfield was granted a security interest in the Company's intellectual
	property.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	outstanding principal and interest on the Deerfield Note was convertible, at the option of Deerfield, upon consummation of a qualified financing (a "Deerfield Qualified Financing")
	or at any time in which amounts remain unpaid under the Deerfield Note into shares of the same class and series of capital stock of the Company issued to the other investors in the Deerfield Qualified
	Financing at a conversion price per share equal to the lowest price per share at which the Deerfield Qualified Financing securities are sold by the Company to the investors in the Deerfield Qualified
	Financing. If the Company failed to complete a Deerfield Qualified Financing, Deerfield would be entitled to a 2.5% origination fee on the principal amount of the Deerfield Note, as well as
	reimbursement of out of its out of pocket expenses.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Company recorded the Deerfield Note in accordance with the guidance found in ASC 470-20. The conversion feature in the Deerfield Note qualifies for the exception from derivative
	accounting in accordance with ASC 815-40. Under ASC 470-20, the fair value of the liability component of the Deerfield Note was determined to be the principal amount of $500,000 as the Deerfield Note
	contained no additional conversion or embedded features.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	August, 11, 2014, the Company completed a Deerfield Qualified Financing with Deerfield and the outstanding principal amount of, and interest and unpaid interest on, the Deerfield Note
	were converted into 126,991 shares of Class&nbsp;C preferred stock at a conversion price of $3.96 per share.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	142
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<!-- THIS IS THE END OF A COMPOSITION COMPONENT -->
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2227870Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_FS45901_1_143">
</A>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_BASECOLOR,"BLACK" -->

<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227870Z10-K_HTM_BG45901A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	AveXis,&nbsp;Inc.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	12. Stock-based Compensation
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
<U>
	Mr.&nbsp;Carbona Purchase Right Agreement
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	October&nbsp;9, 2013, the Company and Mr.&nbsp;Carbona entered into a Purchase Right Agreement. Under the agreement, the Company provided
	Mr.&nbsp;Carbona an option to purchase 1,176,588 shares of the Company's common stock, par value $0.0001, for an aggregate purchase price of $0.02 (the "Purchase Right"). The Purchase Right was
	exercisable until October&nbsp;11, 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Purchase Right was exercised by Mr.&nbsp;Carbona in the allotted time and settled in cash. As a result, the Company issued 1,176,588 shares of common stock to Mr.&nbsp;Carbona.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	the award was fully vested on the date of grant and there was no service to be performed by Mr.&nbsp;Carbona in order to retain the shares, the Company recognized compensation
	expense in the amount of $1,227,744 representing the difference between the fair value of the shares on the date of grant and the $0.02 paid by Mr.&nbsp;Carbona. Such amount is included within
	general and administrative expense in the consolidated statement of operations and comprehensive loss for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013. The Company estimated the fair value of the common
	stock underlying the award to be $1.04 per share utilizing the framework of the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	American Institute of Certified Public Accountants Practice Aid, Valuation of
	Privately-Held-Company Equity Securities Issued as Compensation
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(the "AICPA Practice Guide"), including an independent third party valuation (see the discussion regarding the
	Company's October&nbsp;9, 2013 common stock valuation below).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
<U>
	Mr.&nbsp;Carbona Stock Purchase and Option Agreement
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	January&nbsp;30, 2014, JDH, West Summit and Mr.&nbsp;Carbona entered into a Stock Purchase and Option Agreement. Under the agreement, JDH and West
	Summit sold 392,287 common shares to Mr.&nbsp;Carbona for the price per share of $0.00007, or $28.44 in the aggregate. Additionally, the agreement contained a cross option (the "Cross Option"),
	which provided Mr.&nbsp;Carbona the option to buy one-third of any eligible shares acquired in the future by JDH or West Summit for the price paid by them to acquire the shares, and provided JDH or
	West Summit the option to buy one-third of any eligible shares acquired in the future by Mr.&nbsp;Carbona, JDH or West Summit for the price paid by them to acquire the shares. The Cross Option would
	only terminate upon a reorganization or merger of the Company, a sale of the assets of the Company or an initial public offering.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	the shares sold to Mr.&nbsp;Carbona were fully vested on the date of the purchase and there was no service to be performed by Mr.&nbsp;Carbona in order to retain the shares, the
	Company recognized compensation expense in the amount of $594,088 representing the difference between the fair value of
	the shares on the date of agreement and the amount paid by Mr.&nbsp;Carbona to JDH and West Summit. Such amount is included within general and administrative expense in the consolidated statements
	of operations and comprehensive loss for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. The Company estimated the fair value of the common stock on the date of the agreement to be $1.51 per common share
	utilizing the framework of the AICPA Practice Guide, including an independent third party valuation (see the discussion regarding the Company's January&nbsp;28, 2014 common stock valuation below).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Although
	the Cross Option was fully vested on the grant date, it was not exercisable unless one of the other parties (JDH or West Summit) to the agreement acquired additional shares of
	stock in the future (a performance condition). Because the agreement contained a performance condition, the Company concluded that the award was an equity classified award. ASC 718 indicates that a
	company should recognize compensation cost for awards with performance conditions if and when the company
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	143
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=147,EFW="2227870",CP="AVEXIS INC.",DN="1",CHK=979090,FOLIO='143',FILE='DISK129:[16ZAR1.16ZAR45901]FS45901A.;9',USER='HYUNG',CD='18-MAR-2016;13:27' -->
<A NAME="A2227870Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_FS45901_1_144">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227870Z10-K_HTM_BG45901A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	AveXis,&nbsp;Inc.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	12. Stock-based Compensation (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	concludes
	that it is probable that the performance condition will be achieved, net of an estimate of pre-vesting forfeitures over the requisite service period. Because the performance option contained
	in the award was not probable of being satisfied until such time as the event (the purchase of shares by JDH or West Summit) occurred, no expense was recognized for the award.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	connection with the termination of Mr.&nbsp;Carbona's employment in April 2015 (see Note&nbsp;15), the Stock Purchase and Option Agreement was terminated. In connection with the
	termination of this agreement, the parties agreed to one-final true-up of the Cross Option. As a result, it was agreed that Mr.&nbsp;Carbona would transfer, for no additional consideration,
	one-third of the 207,000 stock options that he had been granted in June 2014 to each of JDH and West Summit. Contemporaneously, with such true-up, the parties terminated the Cross Option. Because
	Mr.&nbsp;Carbona never exercised the Cross Option to acquire additional shares from JDH or West Summit, no expense related to this Cross Option was recognized by the Company in its historical
	financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
<U>
	Mr.&nbsp;Carbona Share Exchange
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	discussed in Note&nbsp;10, on January&nbsp;30, 2014, the Company entered into an Exchange Agreement pursuant to which Mr.&nbsp;Carbona exchanged
	202,347 common shares held by him for 202,347 Class&nbsp;B-1 preferred shares. There was no consideration paid by Mr.&nbsp;Carbona in connection with such exchange.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Under
	ASC 718 such exchange was accounted for as a modification of previously issued common stock awards made to Mr.&nbsp;Carbona. Since Mr.&nbsp;Carbona's common shares were
	replaced with vested Class&nbsp;B-1 preferred shares, the Company recognized $193,549 in additional stock-based compensation cost, representing the difference between the $2.47 fair value of the
	Class&nbsp;B-1 preferred shares issued in the exchange and the fair value of the common shares surrendered in the exchange. Such amount is included within general and administrative expense in the
	consolidated statement of operations and comprehensive loss for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. The Company estimated the fair value of the common stock underlying the award to be $1.51 per
	common share utilizing the framework of the AICPA Practice Guide, including an independent third party valuation (see the discussion regarding the Company's January&nbsp;28, 2014 common stock
	valuation below).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
<U>
	2014 Stock Plan
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	May 2014, the Company's Board of Directors adopted the 2014 Stock Plan (the "Plan"), which allows for the granting of incentive stock options, non-statutory
	stock options, stock appreciation rights, restricted stock awards and other stock awards to directors, officers and employees of the Company. The Plan is intended to encourage ownership of common
	stock by the Company's employees and non-employee directors, in order to attract and retain such people, to induce them to work for the benefit of the Company and to provide additional incentive for
	them to promote the Company's success. The Plan is administered by the compensation committee of the Company's Board of Directors. The administrator of the Plan has the power to determine the form,
	amount and timing of each award, the exercise price, and the conditions of exercise. As of December&nbsp;31, 2014, the number of common shares available for grant under the Plan is equal to 10% of
	the total number of issued and outstanding shares of the Company's common stock, on a fully-diluted, as-converted basis, but in no event shall exceed 1,654,436 common shares. On July&nbsp;22, 2015,
	the Company's Board of Directors approved an increase in the number of common shares available for grant under the Plan of 492,015 common shares. The Company's stockholders approved the amendment to
	the Plan in July 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	144
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=148,EFW="2227870",CP="AVEXIS INC.",DN="1",CHK=487991,FOLIO='144',FILE='DISK129:[16ZAR1.16ZAR45901]FS45901A.;9',USER='HYUNG',CD='18-MAR-2016;13:27' -->

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">

	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	AveXis,&nbsp;Inc.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	12. Stock-based Compensation (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Company has not granted stock appreciation rights or restricted stock awards to directors, officers or employees under the Plan since its inception. Options generally expire ten
	years following the date of grant. Options typically vest over a period of two to four years, but vesting provisions can vary by award based on the discretion of the Board of Directors. Certain awards
	issued by the Company include performance conditions that must be achieved in order for vesting to occur. Options to purchase common stock carry an exercise price equal to the estimated fair value of
	the Company's common stock on the date of grant. Options to purchase shares of the Company's common stock may be exercised by payment of the exercise price in cash, by the delivery of previously
	acquired shares of common stock having a fair value equal to the exercise price payable or the withholding of common shares equal to the fair value of the aggregate exercise price. Upon the
	termination of service of a
	holder of stock options awarded under the Plan, all unvested options are immediately forfeited and vested options may be exercised within six months of termination.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Shares
	of common stock underlying awards previously issued under the Plan which are reacquired by the Company, withheld by the Company in payment of the purchase price, exercise price,
	or withholding taxes, expired, cancelled due to forfeiture, or otherwise terminated other than by exercise, are added to the number of shares of common stock available for issuance under the Plan.
	Shares available for issuance under the Plan may be authorized but unissued shares of the Company's common stock or common stock reacquired by the Company and held in treasury. The Plan expires ten
	years from the date it was approved by the Board of Directors.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	following table summarizes stock option activity:
</FONT>
</P>

<!-- COMMAND=ADD_LINERULETXT,NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="26%" ALIGN="LEFT" -->

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(a)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	aggregate intrinsic value is calculated as the difference between the exercise price of the underlying options and the estimated fair value of the
	common stock for the options that were in-the-money at December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2015.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>

<FONT SIZE=2>
	145
</FONT>

	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	AveXis,&nbsp;Inc.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	12. Stock-based Compensation (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	of December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2015, 919,391 and 190,575 shares of common stock, respectively, were available for future grants under the Plan. During the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2015, the total number of stock options exercised was 0 and 207,000, respectively, resulting in total proceeds of $0 and $520,606 respectively. The total intrinsic value
	of options exercised during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2015 was $0 and $3,565,436, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	of December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2015, there was $319,448 and $12,942,684, respectively, of unrecognized stock-based compensation expense related to employees' awards that is expected
	to be recognized over a weighted-average period of 1.4 and 1.9&nbsp;years, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Company has recorded aggregate stock-based compensation expense related to the issuance of stock option awards under the Plan in the consolidated statements of operations and
	comprehensive loss as follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_19"></A>

	compensation expense related to employee stock options. The weighted-average grant date fair value of options granted during the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014 was $16.44 and $1.47,
	respectively, on the date of grant using the Black-Scholes option-pricing model with the following weighted-average assumptions:

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Valuation of Common Stock.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company estimates the fair value of common stock underlying stock option awards at the grant date of the
	award.
	Valuation estimates are prepared by management in accordance with the framework of the AICPA Practice Guide, with the assistance of independent third party valuations, and are approved by the
	Company's Board of Directors.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Company's valuations of its common stock as of October&nbsp;9, 2013, January&nbsp;28, 2014, March&nbsp;7, 2014, March&nbsp;31, 2014, June&nbsp;30, 2014, August&nbsp;11,
	2014, September&nbsp;30, 2014, December&nbsp;31, 2014, March&nbsp;31, 2015, June&nbsp;30, 2015, September&nbsp;30, 2015 and December&nbsp;31, 2015 were based on a number of objective and
	subjective factors, including external market conditions affecting the Company's industry sector, the prices at which the Company sold shares of its common stock, and the likelihood of achieving a
	liquidity event such as an initial public offering.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	146
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227870Z10-K_HTM_BG45901A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	AveXis,&nbsp;Inc.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	12. Stock-based Compensation (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	October&nbsp;9, 2013 Valuation
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In order to estimate the value of the Company's common stock as of October&nbsp;9, 2013, the Company determined the aggregate equity
	value of its business using the income approach (discounted cash flow analysis).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	income approach measures the value of an asset by the present value of its future economic benefits. These benefits can include earnings, cost savings, tax deductions and proceeds
	from its disposition. Value indications are developed by discounting expected future cash flows to their present value at a rate of return that incorporates the risks associated with the particular
	investment. The following table summarizes the significant assumptions used to determine the fair value of the Company's common stock of $1.04 per share as of October&nbsp;9, 2013:
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_21"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;WIDTH:70%;MARGIN-LEFT:15%;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
</FONT>
</P>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TABLEWIDTH,"100%" -->
<!-- USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR>
<!-- TABLE COLUMN WIDTHS SET -->
<TD WIDTH="" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="12PT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7PT" ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="61PT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="12PT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
</TD>
<!-- TABLE COLUMN WIDTHS END -->
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-LEFT:10PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Equity value of the Company
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>

	$
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	9,100,000
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>

</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="WHITE" VALIGN="BOTTOM">

	Discount adjustment applied to cash flows
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>

	&nbsp;

</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	%
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-LEFT:10PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Weighted average cost of capital
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>

</FONT>

<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">

<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">

<FONT SIZE=2>

<FONT SIZE=2>

</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>

</FONT>
</TD>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<!-- END OF USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	January&nbsp;28, 2014 Valuation
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In order to estimate the value of the Company's common stock as of January&nbsp;28, 2014, the Company determined the aggregate equity
	value of its business using a linear interpolation of the October&nbsp;9, 2013 valuation and the March&nbsp;7, 2014 common stock valuation (see below) in deriving the fair of its common stock of
	$1.51 per share as of January&nbsp;28, 2014. The Company's board of directors considered this methodology appropriate given the Company's progress in its research and development programs during
	this period, the status of license negotiations with third parties, its financial position and external market conditions impacting the industry.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	March&nbsp;7, 2014 Valuation
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On March&nbsp;7, 2014, the Company entered into an arms-length transaction to issue and sell its Class&nbsp;B-1 preferred stock at
	a price per share of $2.47. The Company's common stock valuation as of such date was prepared using both an option-pricing method, or OPM, and a probability-weighted expected return method, or PWERM,
	depending on the form and timing of an expected future liquidity event. The combination of the two approaches to arrive at a concluded fair value estimate of the common stock is known as a hybrid
	approach. The hybrid approach applies and weights the method that is best suited to the form of liquidity and what is known about the range of possible future equity values given the timing and form
	of a future event. The PWERM looks to a specific future range of total equity values based on an initial public offering. The OPM looks to a sale event and distinguishes between equity classes rather
	than future equity values. The OPM treats the common stock and Class&nbsp;B-1 preferred stock as call options on the total equity value of a company, with exercise prices based on the value
	thresholds at which the allocation among the various holders of a company's securities changes. Under this method, the common stock has value only if the funds available for distribution to
	stockholders exceeded the value of the Class&nbsp;B-1 preferred stock liquidation preference at the time of the liquidity event, such as a strategic sale or a merger. The PWERM is a scenario-based
	methodology that estimates the fair value of the common stock based upon an analysis of future values for the company, assuming various outcomes. The common stock value is based on the
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	147
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=151,EFW="2227870",CP="AVEXIS INC.",DN="1",CHK=588309,FOLIO='147',FILE='DISK129:[16ZAR1.16ZAR45901]FS45901A.;9',USER='HYUNG',CD='18-MAR-2016;13:27' -->
<A NAME="A2227870Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_FS45901_1_148">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227870Z10-K_HTM_BG45901A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	AveXis,&nbsp;Inc.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	12. Stock-based Compensation (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	probability-weighted&nbsp;present
	value of expected future investment returns considering each of the possible outcomes available as well as the rights of each class of stock. The future value of
	the common stock under each outcome is discounted back to the valuation date at an appropriate risk-adjusted discount rate and probability weighted to arrive at an indication of value for the common
	stock. The hybrid methodology weights the results from each approach, the OPM and the PWERM, to arrive at an indication of value for the common stock.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Based
	on the above, the Company derived the fair value of its common stock to be $1.68 per share as of March&nbsp;7, 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	March&nbsp;31, 2014 Valuation
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In order to estimate the value of the Company's common stock as of March&nbsp;31, 2014, the Company determined the aggregate equity
	value of its business using a weighted interpolation, giving a 50% weight to the March&nbsp;7, 2014 valuation (see above) and a 50% weight to the August&nbsp;11, 2014 valuation (see below) in
	deriving the fair value of its common stock of $2.08 per share as of March&nbsp;31, 2014. In deriving this value, consideration was given to significant events and developments between these two
	valuation dates, including the March&nbsp;21, 2014 entry into the ReGenX License which provided the Company an exclusive worldwide license to the use of the AAV9 vector for the gene therapy
	treatment of SMA in humans, the initiation of the Company's Phase&nbsp;1 clinical trial in April 2014, the dosing of the first patient in the clinical trial May 2014, the submission of an Orphan
	Drug Application to the FDA with respect to AVXS-101 in June 2014 and discussions with potential strategic acquirers of the Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	June&nbsp;30, 2014 Valuation
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In order to estimate the value of the Company's common stock as of June&nbsp;30, 2014, the Company determined the aggregate equity
	value of its business using a weighted interpolation and giving a 10% weight to the March&nbsp;7, 2014 valuation (see above) and a 90% weight to the August&nbsp;11, 2014 valuation (see below) in
	deriving the fair value of its common stock of $2.39 per share as of June&nbsp;30, 2014. In deriving this value, consideration was given to significant events and developments between these two
	valuation dates, including the March&nbsp;21, 2014 entry into the ReGenX License, which provided the Company an exclusive worldwide license to the use of the AAV9 vector for
	the gene therapy treatment of SMA in humans, the initiation of the Company's Phase&nbsp;1 clinical trial in April 2014, the dosing of the first patient in the clinical trial in May 2014, the
	submission of an Orphan Drug Application to the FDA with respect to AVXS-101 in June 2014 and discussions with potential strategic acquirers of the Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	August&nbsp;11, 2014 Valuation
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On August&nbsp;11, 2014, the Company entered into an arms-length transaction to issue and sell its Class&nbsp;C preferred stock at
	a price per share of $3.96. The Company's common stock valuation as of such date was prepared using both an option-pricing method, or OPM, and a probability-weighted expected return method, or PWERM,
	depending on the form and timing of an expected future liquidity event. The combination of the two approaches to arrive at a concluded fair value estimate of the common stock is known as a hybrid
	approach. The hybrid approach applies and weights the method that is best suited to the form of liquidity and what is known about the range of possible future equity
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	148
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=6,SEQ=152,EFW="2227870",CP="AVEXIS INC.",DN="1",CHK=984958,FOLIO='148',FILE='DISK129:[16ZAR1.16ZAR45901]FS45901A.;9',USER='HYUNG',CD='18-MAR-2016;13:27' -->
<A NAME="A2227870Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_FS45901_1_149">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227870Z10-K_HTM_BG45901A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	AveXis,&nbsp;Inc.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	12. Stock-based Compensation (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	values
	given the timing and form of a future event. The PWERM looks to a specific future range of total equity values based on an initial public offering. The OPM looks to a sale event and
	distinguishes between equity classes rather than future equity values. The OPM treats the common stock, Class&nbsp;B-1 and Class&nbsp;C preferred stock as call options on the total equity value of
	a company, with exercise prices based on the value thresholds at which the allocation among the various holders of a company's securities changes. Under this method, the common stock has value only if
	the funds available for distribution to stockholders exceeded the value of the Class&nbsp;C and Class&nbsp;B-1 preferred stock liquidation preference at the time of the liquidity event, such as a
	strategic sale or a merger. The PWERM is a scenario-based methodology that estimates the fair value of the common stock based upon an analysis of future values for the company, assuming various
	outcomes. The common stock value is based on the probability-weighted present value of expected future investment returns considering each of the possible outcomes available as well as the rights of
	each class of stock. The future value of the common stock under each outcome is discounted back to the valuation date at an appropriate risk-adjusted discount rate and probability weighted to arrive
	at an indication of value for the common stock. The hybrid methodology weights the results from each approach, the OPM and the PWERM, to arrive at an indication of value for the common stock. Based on
	the above, the Company derived the fair value of its common stock to be $2.47 per share as of August&nbsp;11, 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	September&nbsp;30, 2014 Valuation
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In order to estimate the value of the Company's common stock as of September&nbsp;30, 2014, the Company determined the aggregate
	equity value of its business interpolating the implied equity value from the August&nbsp;11, 2014 valuation (see above) and the $15.94 price per common share paid in an arms-length transaction
	between stockholders of the Company in May 2015. In deriving this value, consideration was given to significant events and developments between these two valuation dates, including the dosing of the
	second patient in the Phase&nbsp;1 clinical trial in August 2014, the dosing of the third patient in the trial in September 2014 and the receipt of Orphan Drug designation for AVXS-101 from the FDA
	in September 2014, as well as discussions with potential strategic acquirers of the Company. The interpolated value was determined to be reasonable using additional PWERM analysis. Based on the above,
	the Company derived the fair value of its common stock to be $4.69 per share as of September&nbsp;30, 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	December&nbsp;31, 2014 Valuation
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In order to estimate the value of the Company's common stock as of December&nbsp;31, 2014, the Company determined the aggregate
	equity value of its business interpolating the implied equity value from the August&nbsp;11, 2014 valuation (see above) and the $15.94 price per common share paid in an arms-length transaction
	between stockholders of the Company in May 2015. In deriving this value, consideration was given to significant events and developments between these two valuation dates, including the dosing of the
	second patient in the Phase&nbsp;1 clinical trial in August 2014, the dosing of the third patient in the trial in September 2014, the receipt of Orphan Drug designation for AVXS-101 from the FDA in
	September 2014, and the dosing of the fourth patient in the trial in December 2014, as well as discussions with potential strategic acquirers of the Company and the likelihood of achieving a liquidity
	event, such as an initial public offering, or a sale of the Company in light of prevailing market conditions. Based on the above, the Company derived the fair value of its common stock to be $8.31 per
	share as of December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	149
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

<!-- ZEQ.=7,SEQ=153,EFW="2227870",CP="AVEXIS INC.",DN="1",CHK=306003,FOLIO='149',FILE='DISK129:[16ZAR1.16ZAR45901]FS45901A.;9',USER='HYUNG',CD='18-MAR-2016;13:27' -->
<A NAME="A2227870Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_FS45901_1_150">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227870Z10-K_HTM_BG45901A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	AveXis,&nbsp;Inc.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	12. Stock-based Compensation (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	March&nbsp;31, 2015 Valuation
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In order to estimate the value of the Company's common stock as of March&nbsp;31, 2015, the Company determined the aggregate equity
	value of its business interpolating the implied equity value from the August&nbsp;11, 2014 valuation (see above) and the $15.94 price per common share paid in an arms-length transaction between
	stockholders in May 2015. In deriving this value, consideration was given to significant events and developments between these two valuation dates, including the dosing of the second patient in the
	Phase&nbsp;1 clinical trial in August 2014, the dosing of the third patient in the trial in September 2014, the receipt of Orphan Drug designation for AVXS-101 from the FDA in September 2014, the
	dosing of the fourth patient in the trial in December 2014, the dosing of the fifth patient in the trial in January 2015, the dosing of the sixth patient in the trial in February 2015, the submission
	of an application for Orphan Drug Designation to the European Medicines Agency, and the satisfaction of the Class&nbsp;C Milestone Event, which resulted in the sale of 1,102,945 Class&nbsp;C
	shares for $5,000,020 in March 2015. Additionally, the Company considered discussions with potential strategic acquirers of its business and the likelihood of achieving a liquidity event, such as an
	initial public offering, or a sale of the Company in light of prevailing market conditions. Based on the above, the Company derived the fair value of its common stock to be $11.97 per share as of
	March&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	June&nbsp;30, 2015 Valuation
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In order to estimate the value of the Company's common stock as of June&nbsp;30, 2015, the Company determined the aggregate equity
	value of its business utilizing the $15.94 price per common share paid in two separate arms-length transactions between stockholders in May and June of 2015. Additionally, the Company considered
	discussions with potential strategic acquirers of its business and the likelihood of achieving a liquidity event, such as an initial public offering, or IPO, or a sale of the Company in light of
	prevailing market conditions. Based on the above, the Company derived the fair value of its common stock to be $15.94 per share as of June&nbsp;30, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	September&nbsp;30, 2015 Valuation
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In order to estimate the value of the Company's common stock as of September&nbsp;30, 2015, the Company determined the aggregate
	equity value of its business utilizing the $21.01 price per share paid in September 2015 for Class&nbsp;D preferred stock. Given the arm's length nature and due diligence associated with the
	Class&nbsp;D preferred stock transaction, the Company
	considered this financing round to be a meaningful indicator of total equity value at the time of the financing. In deriving the value, consideration was given to the Class&nbsp;D financing, the
	Company's capital structure, and the outlook for a liquidity event (form and timing). The common stock was valued under two scenarios: (i)&nbsp;an IPO scenario, in which the Company completes an
	initial public offering in the near-term and (ii)&nbsp;a dissolution scenario, in which the Company experiences significant setbacks, either clinically or operationally or both, and is forced to
	liquidate its assets. The total equity value of the Company in the IPO scenario was implied based on the Class&nbsp;D preferred stock issuance price. Both scenarios are weighted based on
	expectations of future liquidity events and expressed in a single concluded per share value. A discount for lack of marketability was applied to reflect the relative increased risk arising from the
	inability to readily sell the shares of a private company. The Company also considered recent secondary sales of the common stock in arms-length transactions between stockholders. During the three
	months ended September&nbsp;30, 2015, a total 615,589 shares of common stock were sold, each for $18.48 per share. The Company gave some weight to the transactions given their material size and that
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	150
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=8,SEQ=154,EFW="2227870",CP="AVEXIS INC.",DN="1",CHK=571963,FOLIO='150',FILE='DISK129:[16ZAR1.16ZAR45901]FS45901A.;9',USER='HYUNG',CD='18-MAR-2016;13:27' -->
<A NAME="A2227870Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_FS45901_1_151">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>

	Table of Contents
</A>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	AveXis,&nbsp;Inc.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements (Continued)
</B>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	12. Stock-based Compensation (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	several
	outside investors were involved. However, the Company observed that all the buyers were existing investors and/or related parties; therefore, they may not represent an arms-length transaction.
	Based on the above, the Company derived the fair value of its common stock to be $18.17 per share as of September&nbsp;30, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	December&nbsp;31, 2015 Valuation
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In order to estimate the value of the Company's common stock as of December&nbsp;31, 2015 the Company determined the value under two
	scenarios: (1)&nbsp;an IPO scenario, in which the Company contemplates an initial public offering in the near-term and (2)&nbsp;a dissolution scenario. The valuation was based on a recent
	financing and continuing expectations for an IPO. The IPO scenario in the September&nbsp;30, 2015 valuation reflected a range of total equity value based on the Class&nbsp;D common stock issuance,
	giving full consideration to the Company's capital structure and its outlook for a liquidity event (form and timing). Given the steady progress of the Company operationally and clinically, the current
	IPO scenario carries forward the implied total equity value to December&nbsp;31, 2015. Adjustments were made to reflect the current capital structure and outlook for a liquidity event. The IPO
	scenario and dissolution scenario are weighted based on expectations of future liquidity events and expressed as a single concluded per share value. A discount for lack of marketability (DLOM) was
	applied to reflect the relative increased risk arising from the inability to readily sell the shares of a private company. Based on the above, the Company derived the fair value of its common stock to
	be $19.74 per share as of December 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Restricted Stock Granted to Non-Employees
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In January 2014, the Company issued 2,334,391 shares of restricted common stock to a member of the Company's Board of Directors
	pursuant to a consulting agreement for scientific advisory services to be performed by the director on behalf of the Company. Of these shares, 583,597 common shares were vested at the time of grant
	and the remaining restricted shares are scheduled to vest in the amount of 25% per year on the second, third and fourth anniversary of the grant date. The unvested shares are subject to repurchase at
	$0.00007 per share, by the Company should the advisor's consulting arrangement terminate for certain specified reasons (see Note&nbsp;21).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	unvested shares under the award are being revalued each period until they vest. Compensation expense is recorded using the Graded Vesting Attribution Method over the vesting period
	of each separate vesting tranche of the award. The award had a grant date fair value of $3,535,419. The Company recorded compensation expense of $19,322,275, $5,749,791 and $0 in the years ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, respectively, related to this award, within research and development expense in the consolidated statements of operations.
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT SIZE=2>
	151
</FONT>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	restricted common shares that are subject to repurchase by the Company represent unvested, forfeitable equity instruments issued to the consultant in consideration for future
	services. The repurchase feature, therefore is the equivalent to a forfeiture provision and is in effect an in-substance service period. As such, these shares are not reflected as issued equity for
	accounting purposes until the future services are received (see Note&nbsp;21).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
<U>
	Warrants Granted to Non-Employees
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	March&nbsp;17, 2014, the Company entered into a letter agreement (the "Letter Agreement") with Pavilion XI Partners,&nbsp;LLC ("Pavilion") to provide
	certain payments and warrants for consulting services to be provided to the Company by Pavilion. Under the Letter Agreement, the Company granted Pavilion warrants to purchase an aggregate of 241,500
	shares of common stock as described below.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	August&nbsp;5, 2014, the Company issued to Pavilion a warrant to purchase 138,000 shares of common stock at an exercise price of $2.47 per share (the "First Warrant"). The First
	Warrant became exercisable as follows: 69,000 shares were exercisable immediately upon issuance; 34,500 shares became exercisable upon the purchase by PBM of the Class&nbsp;B Milestone Shares; and
	34,500 shares became exercisable on January&nbsp;26, 2015. The First Warrant was exercised in full in May 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Also
	on August&nbsp;5, 2014, the Company issued to Pavilion a warrant to purchase 103,500 shares of common stock at an exercise price of $4.94 per share (the "Second Warrant"). The
	Second Warrant would only begin to vest if the principal of Pavilion became a full time employee of the Company on or before January&nbsp;1, 2015. If the principal of Pavilion was not a full time
	employee of the Company by such date, the Second Warrant would be become null and void. As of December&nbsp;31, 2014, there had been no performance commitment or measurement date for the Second
	Warrant and as a result no compensation expense had been recognized by the Company with respect to the Second Warrant. Because the principal of Pavilion did not become a full time employee of the
	Company by January&nbsp;1, 2015, on such date, the Second Warrant expired and was forfeited.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	152
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	First Warrant was revalued each period until the award vested. Compensation expense was recorded on a straight-line basis over the vesting period of each separated vesting tranche of
	the award. The First Warrant had a grant date fair value of $146,000. The Company recorded compensation expense of $358,637 and $243,863 in the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014,
	respectively, related to the First Warrant, within research and development expense in the consolidated statements of operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During
	the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, the total number of stock warrants exercised was 138,000 and 0, respectively, resulting in total proceeds of $341,000 and $0,
	respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	13. Net Loss Per Common Share and Unaudited Pro Forma Net Loss Per Common Share
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Net Loss per Common Share
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Basic net loss per common share is computed using the weighted average number of common shares outstanding during the period. Diluted
	net loss per common share is computed using the sum of the weighted average number of common shares outstanding during the
	period and, if dilutive, the weighted average number of potential shares of common stock, including the assumed exercise of stock options, stock warrants and unvested restricted common stock. The
	Company applies the two-class method to calculate its basic and diluted net loss per share attributable to common stockholders, as its preferred stock and common stock are participating securities.
	The two-class method is an earnings allocation formula that treats a participating security as having rights to earnings that otherwise would have been available to common stockholders. However, the
	two-class method does not impact the net loss per share of common stock as the Company was in a net loss position for each of the periods presented and preferred stockholders do not participate in
	losses. For the years ended December&nbsp;31,
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	153
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	14. Employment Agreements
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On August&nbsp;7, 2014, the Company entered into employment agreements with four employees. The terms of these agreements ranged between 2-3&nbsp;years. Each of the agreements
	provided for an annual salary, a discretionary bonus as determined by the Company's Board of Directors, an additional bonus should the value of the Company's common stock as traded on a national stock
	exchange equal or exceed certain pre-defined thresholds for a period of 90 consecutive days (the "Valuation Bonus") and severance obligations in the event of the termination of employment by the
	Company with or without cause or by the employee for good reason, as defined in the agreements. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, three of the above employment agreements remain in effect (see
	Note&nbsp;15).
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	154
</FONT>
</P>

</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	14. Employment Agreements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	aggregate amount of Valuation Bonus potentially payable pursuant to such agreements at December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2015 was $1,075,000 and $450,000, respectively. As of
	December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2015, no Valuation Bonus had been earned by any of the employees or accrued by the Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Company is accounting for the Valuation Bonuses as liability-based awards under ASC 718. The Valuation Bonus awards contain both a performance condition (i.e.,&nbsp;the Company's
	stock needs to be traded on a nationally-recognized stock exchange in the United States) and a market condition (i.e.,&nbsp;vesting is contingent upon the achievement and maintenance of specified
	stock price thresholds). Once the performance condition has been met (i.e.,&nbsp;upon the listing of the common stock on a nationally-recognized stock exchange in the United States), the awards will
	be immediately recognized at fair value. Subsequent changes in fair value will be recognized through earnings each reporting period.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	June&nbsp;8, 2015, the Company entered into an employment agreement with its new chief executive officer, Mr.&nbsp;Sean P. Nolan. The agreement provides for an annual salary,
	discretionary bonus as determined by the Company's Board of Directors, severance obligations in the event of termination of employment by the Company without cause or by the employee for good reason,
	as defined in the agreement, and an initial grant of 738,300 stock options with an exercise price of $15.94 per common share. These options shall vest 25% on the first anniversary of the grant date,
	with the remaining 75% vesting in equal amounts at the end of each calendar month for the ensuing 36-month period. In the event the Company shall experience a sale event, as defined in the agreement,
	during the first four months of Mr.&nbsp;Nolan's employment, 50% of his options will vest as of the closing of the sale event. In the event the Company shall experience a sale event, as defined in
	the agreement, after the first four months of Mr.&nbsp;Nolan's employment, all of his unvested options shall become vested upon the closing of the sale event. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, the
	Company had recognized $2,681,578 in employee stock compensation expense related to Mr.&nbsp;Nolan's stock option grant. Such amount is included in general and administrative expense for the year
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	15.&nbsp;Separation Agreement
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On April&nbsp;22, 2015, Mr.&nbsp;Carbona ceased to be an employee of the Company. In connection with the termination of his employment, the Company agreed to pay Mr.&nbsp;Carbona
	the amount of $535,000, consisting of a $500,000 severance benefit (the "Severance") and $35,000 of accrued and unused vacation (the "Vacation Pay").
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Severance is to be paid over a 12&nbsp;month period in equal monthly installments. However, under the terms of the separation agreement, in the event Mr.&nbsp;Carbona were to
	resign, or be removed from, his service on the Company's Board, then (i)&nbsp;50% of the then unpaid portion of Severance due to Mr.&nbsp;Carbona would be paid to Mr.&nbsp;Carbona in a lump sum
	within 30&nbsp;days from the termination of his service on the Board and (ii)&nbsp;the remaining 50% of the unpaid Severance due Mr.&nbsp;Carbona would be paid in equal installments over the
	lesser of (a)&nbsp;six months or (b)&nbsp;the remainder of the original 12&nbsp;month period. The Vacation Pay was paid in a lump sum in May 2015. In June 2015, Mr.&nbsp;Carbona's service on
	the Board terminated.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	connection with the transactions described above, the Company recorded a charge of $535,000 in its consolidated statements of operations for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015.
	Such amount is included within general and administrative expense in the consolidated statement of operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	155
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

<A NAME="A2227870Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_FU45901_1_156">

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227870Z10-K_HTM_BG45901A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	AveXis,&nbsp;Inc.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	15.&nbsp;Separation Agreement (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Additionally,
	the Company agreed to fully accelerate the vesting of 53,820 unvested stock options held by Mr.&nbsp;Carbona at the time of the termination of his employment. The Company
	determined that the acceleration of vesting was a Type&nbsp;III modification pursuant to ASC 718. Therefore, the Company recognized the incremental fair value of the awards as of the modification
	date and recognized the
	amount immediately since the awards did not require further service. In connection with this modification, the Company recorded a charge of $503,502 in its consolidated statement of operations for the
	year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015. Such amount is included within general and administrative expense.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	connection with the termination of his employment, Mr.&nbsp;Carbona also agreed to transfer to the Company all shares of Sixeva held by entities affiliated with him and to terminate
	the Cross Option (see Note&nbsp;12).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	16. Commitments and Contingencies
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Operating Leases
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In March 2014, the Company entered into a lease agreement, which expires in April 2017, for approximately 2,418 square feet of office
	space in Dallas, Texas. The lease agreement provides for annual escalation in rent payments during the lease term. The Company is amortizing the escalation in rental payments on a straight-line basis
	over the term of the lease.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Future
	minimum lease payments under this lease are as follows:
